Package home.functional.streams

Class StreamExample

java.lang.Object
home.functional.streams.StreamExample
class StreamExample
extends java.lang.Object
this class contains a set of utility functions to test the Stream class. The purpose is learning how to apply functional programming paradigm in order to simplify a set of complex functions, which otherwise would take too long to be written.
See Also:
Stream Class tutorial

  • Method Details

    • main

      public static void main​(java.lang.String[] args)

    • collector

      private static java.util.Map<java.lang.Double,​java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer>> collector​(java.util.stream.Stream<java.lang.String> stream)
      This method is an example of the usage of the Stream.collect method, which transforms a Stream object to a collection, (a Map here). The output Map is a set of keys and values. The keys are Double variables, the values are Arraylists of integers. There are 2 Functions that elaborate the set of strings in input: the keyMapper Function takes a string and calculates the corresponding key value. The valueMapper Function takes an input string and generates a list of integers from it. One necessary requirement for the input stream is that every element must be distinct from the others, since the mapping is a 1-to-1 unique relationship.
      Parameters:
      stream - the input stream containing only distinct words
      Returns:
      a new map where the keys are Double numbers, and the values are an arraylist of integers

    • mapper

      private static java.util.stream.Stream<java.lang.String> mapper​(java.util.stream.Stream<java.lang.String> stream)
      the Map is used to modify the elements in the stream, by using a Function class, implemented with a lambda expression. In this example, every character is modified by calculating the ascii code and shifting it of 10 positions. The resulting string is composed of all the characters concatenated.
      Parameters:
      stream - input
      Returns:
      the new stream modified from the input one

    • filterer

      private static java.util.stream.Stream<java.lang.String> filterer​(java.util.stream.Stream<java.lang.String> stream)
      the Filter is used to take a set of the elements of the stream that satisfy a boolean formula (expressed with a Predicate class). in this example, it returns a new stream containing the filtered elements accepted by the filter
      Parameters:
      stream - input
      Returns:
      the filtered stream with the algorithm implemented

    • sorting

      private static java.util.stream.Stream<java.lang.String> sorting​(java.util.stream.Stream<java.lang.String> stream)
      sorts the string using the compare method implemented in the lambda expression
      Parameters:
      stream - input stream to be sorted
      Returns:
      the sorted stream, using the simple algorithm implemented with the Comparator interface

    • uniqueWords

      private static java.util.stream.Stream<java.lang.String> uniqueWords​(java.util.stream.Stream<java.lang.String> stream)
      returns a stream with distinct words
      Parameters:
      stream - input
      Returns:
      the array with only the unique words, since it takes the distinct values in it

    • printStream

      private static void printStream​(java.util.stream.Stream<java.lang.String> stream)
      prints the content of the strings
      Parameters:
      stream - a stream of strings
